comment.author: 24736216@N07
comment._content: How can this photo have been "taken March 6, 2013"?  Perhaps an image was scrapped on that date.  The USS Pennsylvania was scrapped by sinking in 1948.

comment.author: 16118167@N04
comment._content: date Means  it was uploaded on March 6 2013

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content:
A few extracts from the Wiki record of the Pennsylvania she was a very distinguished ship when she was decommissioned! 
She was laid down on 27 October 1913, by the Newport News Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company, Newport News, Virginia.[1] She was launched on 16 March 1915, sponsored by Elizabeth Kolb of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and commissioned on 12 June 1916, with Captain Henry B. Wilson in command.
She departed with the Fleet from San Francisco on 15 April 1925, and after war games in the Hawaiian area, departed Honolulu, Hawaii on 1 July, en route to Melbourne, Australia. After a visit to Wellington, New Zealand, she returned to San Pedro on 26 September.
